properties.feesApplyText:
Tenants  Guide to Charges 

JOHNS&CO is a member of and covered by the ARLA/Propertymark Client Money Protection Scheme. JOHNS&CO is also a member of a redress scheme provided by The Property Ombudsman.
            
Permitted Charges in accordance with the Tenant Fee Act 2019

Under the terms of the Tenant Fee Act if you enter into an ASSURED SHORTHOLD TENANCY, payments which may apply will be as follows:

First month s rent - In advance

Tenancy Deposit - 5 or 6 weeks depending upon the rental amount OR a Deposit Replacement Insurance Product at a cost equal to 1 week s rent where offered by the Landlord.

Holding Deposit - Maximum one week s rent

Early termination when requested by the tenant - A charge not exceeding the financial loss experience by the landlord

Default charge for late payment of rent - Limited to interest charged at 3% above Bank of England base rate, when rent is more than 14 days late

Default charge for replacement of lost key or security device - Equivalent to cost incurred

Changing the tenancy documents after the commencement of the tenancy - £41.67 excl. VAT | £50 inc. VAT

Utilities, communication services, TV licence and council tax
            
A Non-Housing Act Tenancy is formed when one of the following criteria is in place:

  The annual rent exceeds £100,000
  The property is not used as a main or primary home      
  The property is occupied by an entity (Company let) rather that an individual
  There is a Resident Landlord

Please speak with our branch staff if you need clarity on which tenancy might apply in your circumstances.

Under the terms of the Tenant Fee Act if you enter into a NON-HOUSING ACT TENANCY, payments which may apply will be as follows (exclusive / inclusive of VAT):
            
Tenancy Setup Fee drafting and execution of tenancy agreement if supplied by us, collecting and holding the Tenancy Deposit as Stakeholder (where applicable), issuing relevant deposit protection certificates (where applicable) - £300 / £360

Check-in Fee checking into the property and reviewing inventory - Minimum of £115.00 / Minimum of £138.00

Comprehensive Reference Fee (per person, per company and per guarantor (if required) - £50 / £60

Renewal Administration negotiating and drafting extension to the fixed term - £150 / £180

Change of Sharer   During a fixed term - £625 / £750

Change of Sharer   At Renewal of fixed term - £250 / £300

Early Termination   Deed of Surrender - £125 / £150

Late payment of rent - Interest will be charged at 3% above the Bank of England base rate

Please note: The holding deposit can be paid on the Goodlord platform by debit card only. All other monies due must be paid via the Goodlord platform or into JOHNS&CO  client account by direct bank transfer. We are unable to accept cash. We do not accept credit cards.

properties.feesApplyText:
For properties in England, the Tenant Fees Act 2019 means that from 1 June 2019, in addition to rent, lettings agents can only charge tenants entering into an Assured Shorthold Tenancy or anyone acting on the tenant's behalf:

- a refundable tenancy deposit capped at no more than 5 weeks' rent where the total annual rent is less than £50,000, or 6 weeks' rent where the total annual rent is £50,000 or above.

- a refundable pre-payment (to reserve a property) capped at no more than 1 week's rent.

- payments associated with early termination of the tenancy, when requested by the tenant.

- £50.00 inc VAT administration fee for completing any tenancy name change's during the tenancy.

- payments in respect of utilities, communication services, TV licence and Council Tax.

- payments arising from a default by the tenant where they have had to replace keys or a respective security device.

- charge for late rent payment (not exceeding 3% above the bank of England base rate).

- any other permitted payments under the Tenant Fees Act 2019.

Tenant protection

In addition to publishing relevant fees, lettings agents are also required to publish details of the redress scheme and Client Money Protection scheme of which they are a member:

- the redress scheme is The Property Ombudsman.

- the Client Money Protection scheme is Propertymark.

For any Assured Shorthold Tenancies that commenced prior to 1 June 2019, the charges in line with the existing Tenancy Agreement will continue to apply until 31 May 2020.

The Fee Ban legislation does not apply to Company lets.

properties.feesApplyText:
As well as paying the rent, you may also be required to make the following permitted payments.

Before the tenancy starts (payable to Strawberry Star 'the Agent')
Holding Deposit: 1 week's rent
Deposit: 5 weeks' rent (or 6 weeks' rent if annual rent exceeds £50,000.00)

During the tenancy (payable to the Agent):
Payment of up to £50.00 inc VAT if you want to change the tenancy agreement
Payment of interest for the late payment of rent at a rate of 3% above Bank of England base rate
Payment of up to £50.00 for the reasonably incurred costs for the loss of keys/security devices
Payment of any unpaid rent or other reasonable costs associated with your early termination of the tenancy

During the tenancy (payable to the provider) if permitted and applicable
Utilities: gas, electricity, water, heating/hot water
Communications: telephone and broadband
Installation of cable/satellite
Subscription to cable/satellite supplier
Television licence Council Tax

Other permitted payments
Any other permitted payments, not included above, under the relevant legislation including contractual damages.

Tenant protection
Strawberry Star is a member of ARLA Propertymark CMP Scheme which is a client money protection scheme, and also a member of TPOS, which is a redress scheme. You can find out more details on the agent's website or by contacting the agent directly.

properties.feesApplyText:
OpenRent is the UK's largest letting agent, using online services to make renting properties cheaper and more convenient than ever before - while holding quality and security as our top priorities.

OpenRent has never charged any administration or agency fees.

Under the Tenant Fees Act 2019, landlords may charge you a fee if you lose keys or other security devices, or pay your rent late. You may also be asked for other permitted payments, such as a holding deposit when you begin your application.

There are no hidden fees or other charges when renting an OpenRent property.

OpenRent is a proud member of the Property Ombudsman and holds comprehensive Client Money Protection via the government-authorised Client Money Protect scheme.

OpenRent is a registered agent in Scotland with registration number LARN1809026 and is a member of RentSmart Wales with license number #LR-75033-48352.

properties.feesApplyText:
Holding Deposit (per tenancy) One week s rent. This is to reserve a property. Please Note: The holding deposit will be withheld if any relevant person (including any guarantor(s)) withdraw from the tenancy, fail a Right-to-Rent check, provide materially significant false or misleading information, or fail to sign their tenancy agreement (and / or Deed of Guarantee) within 15 calendar days (or other Deadline for Agreement as mutually agreed in writing). Should your application be successful the holding deposit will form a proportion of the first month s rent. Once your offer is accepted, we ensure that no other applicant of Fisks London views the property

Security Deposit (per tenancy. Rent under £50,000 per year) Five weeks rent. This covers damages or defaults on the part of the tenant during the tenancy. Deposit replacement insurance. With the landlords agreement we will offer tenants an insurance backed deposit full details of which will be made available on request.

Security Deposit (per tenancy. Rent of £50,000 or over per year) Six weeks rent. This covers damages or defaults on the part of the tenant during the tenancy.

Permitted Tenancy Fees in line with the Tenant Fees Act 2019. You will not be asked to pay any fees or charges in connection with your application for a tenancy. However you will be required to pay certain fees for any breach of that tenancy agreement in line with the Tenant Fees ACT 2019.

Unpaid Rent Interest at 3% above the Bank of England Base Rate from Rent Due Date until paid in order to pursue non-payment of rent. Please Note: This will not be levied until the rent is more than 14 days in arrears.

Lost Key(s) or other Security Device(s) Tenants are liable to the actual cost of replacing any lost key(s) or other security device(s). If the loss results in locks needing to be changed, the actual costs of a locksmith, and new lock and replacement keys for the tenant, landlord any other persons requiring keys will be charged to the tenant. If extra costs are incurred there will be a charge of £15 per hour (inc. VAT) for the time taken replacing lost key(s) or other security device(s).

Variation of Contract (Tenant s Request) £50 (inc. VAT) per agreed variation. To cover the costs associated with taking landlord s instructions as well as the preparation and execution of new legal documents.

Change of Sharer (Tenant s Request) £50 (inc. VAT) per replacement tenant or any reasonable costs incurred if higher. You need to obtain written consent from the landlord before any changes can be made in the identity of the tenants or the occupants of the property. If a requested change is agreed by the landlord, Fisks London will undertake new tenant referencing and Right-to-Rent checks, deposit registration as well as the preparation and execution of new legal documents.

Early Termination (Tenant s Request) Should the tenant wish to leave their contract early this must be with the landlords consent. The tenant shall be liable for the landlord s costs in re-letting the property as well as all rent due under the tenancy until the start date of the replacement tenancy. These costs will be no more than the maximum amount of rent outstanding on the tenancy. Please note that these charges do not apply when exercising an agreed break clause.

Client Money Protection. Fisks London Ltd are members of Propertymark. Our scheme reference number is C0003480.

Fisks London are members of The Property Ombudsman Redress Scheme.

properties.feesApplyText:
DEPOSITS

A £250 holding deposit for properties priced less than £500 per week - or a £500 holding deposit for properties priced £500 per week or more - is taken to secure the property off market subject to acceptance of offer and references. If the landlord accepts the offer, this is deducted from the final moving in monies balance. If the offer is rejected, it is fully refundable with a 5 working day turnaround term.

Option A - Full Security Deposit
An additional sum equivalent of one month's rent is collected from the tenant at the tenancy start and registered with the Deposit Protection Scheme. This is refunded to the tenant at the tenancy end less any deductions made for damage as per the independent inventory check-out, unpaid rent or breach of contract.

Option B - Deposit Replacement Insurance
A non-refundable guarantee is purchased by the tenant at the tenancy start at the rate of 30% of one month's rent. For tenancies longer than 12 months, every 12 months a further fee of £55 is charged. At the tenancy end this independent insurer agrees any further amount due from the tenant for damage as per the independent inventory check-out, unpaid rent or breach of contract. This mitigates the large upfront expense of a full security deposit. Harrisons receive 10% commission for introducing a tenant to the independent insurer.

 

The first month's rent is also payable upfront, prior to moving into a property.

 

PERMITTED TENANT CHARGES

 A 'withdrawal of agreed offer by tenant' fee of £250 is charged should you cancel your offer, or fail to disclose information which could affect your tenancy application references, such as CCJs against you, temporary employment or inaccurate salary after your offer has been accepted by the landlord.

Interest on unpaid rent is payable at 3% above Barclays Bank Plc Base Rate calculated and added daily until the rent is paid.

Amendment of tenancy to include a change of tenant or replacement tenant is charged at £50.

properties.feesApplyText:
HOUSING ACT TENANCIES (AST)
Default fees & charges
Holding deposit - Equivalent of one weeks rent, which will be put towards your first rent due on completion of the tenancy. 
Any specially negotiated clauses agreed after the tenancy agreement is signed - Up to £50, or any reasonable costs incurred if these are higher than £50
Deposit: annual rent less than £50,000 - Equivalent to five weeks' rent
Deposit: annual rent £50,000 or more - Equivalent to six weeks' rent
Change of sharer - Up to £50 inc. VAT for one reference and a new tenancy agreement, or any reasonable costs incurred if these are higher than £50 
Early termination - All costs, fees and charges incurred by the landlord for allowing early termination including the agent's existing or re-letting fees
Late, unpaid, returned rent payments - 3% above the base rate of Bank of England per annum, calculated daily
Lost keys - £60 plus VAT and any cost for the replacement of keys, fobs, security devices or associated items which have been lost, damaged or broken

NON-HOUSING ACT TENANCIES (NHA)

Reservation fee - Equivalent of one weeks rentwhich will be put towards your first rent due on completion of the tenancy. If you withdraw from the tenancy
Tenancy paperwork - £250 
Deposit - Usually equivalent to six weeks rent or if you have a pet this will usually be equivalent to eight weeks
Late/unpaid/returned rent payments - 3% above the base rate of Bank of England per annum, calculated daily
Renewal negotiation - £78 inc. VAT for each renewal. If additional referencing is required £15 per reference
Early termination - All costs, fees and charges incurred by the landlord for allowing early termination including the agent's existing or re-letting fees
Client money protection (CMP) provided by Propertymark
Ombudsman services provided by Property Ombudsman Service

properties.feesApplyText:
Tenant charges

As well as paying rent, as agreed (usually quarterly or monthly in advance), you will also have to pay the following:

Before the tenancy starts:
Deposit (usually equivalent of between five and six weeks' rent dependant on the annual rent)
Tenancy Agreement fee (£276 inclusive of VAT) (Non ASTs or ASTs signed on or after 1 June 2019 only)
Reference fee payable by each tenant/guarantor (£48 inclusive of VAT) (Non ASTs or ASTs signed on or after 1 June 2019 only)
Bank reference fee (refer to your bank as charges vary) (Non ASTs or ASTs signed on or after 1 June 2019 only)
Deposit protection (£24 per annum inclusive of VAT) (ASTs signed before 1 June 2019 only)
Stamp Duty (on tenancies that amount to over £125,000)

During the tenancy:
Utilities (gas, electricity, water and telephone)
Council Tax
Television licence
Installation of cable/satellite (if permitted and applicable)
Subscription to cable/satellite supplier
Insurance (for your personal and own contents)
Garden maintenance

At the end of the tenancy:
Cleaning of the property
Inventory check-out (Non ASTs or ASTs signed before 31 May 2019 only)
Dilapidations (as agreed)
properties.formattedBranchName: by Knight Frank - Lettings, Canary  Wharf

properties.summary: AVAILABLE NOW. JOHNS&CO exclusively offers this brand new one bedroom apartment in the latest Ballymore's development, the highly anticipated Goodluck Hope. Located the 4th floor of Agar House, the property comprises c.574 sq ft and boasts an open plan kitchen living area with concrete effect isl...
properties.displayAddress: Agar House, Goodluck Hope, London, E14
properties.feesApplyText:
Tenants  Guide to Charges 

JOHNS&CO is a member of and covered by the ARLA/Propertymark Client Money Protection Scheme. JOHNS&CO is also a member of a redress scheme provided by The Property Ombudsman.
            
Permitted Charges in accordance with the Tenant Fee Act 2019

Under the terms of the Tenant Fee Act if you enter into an ASSURED SHORTHOLD TENANCY, payments which may apply will be as follows:

First month s rent - In advance

Tenancy Deposit - 5 or 6 weeks depending upon the rental amount OR a Deposit Replacement Insurance Product at a cost equal to 1 week s rent where offered by the Landlord.

Holding Deposit - Maximum one week s rent

Early termination when requested by the tenant - A charge not exceeding the financial loss experience by the landlord

Default charge for late payment of rent - Limited to interest charged at 3% above Bank of England base rate, when rent is more than 14 days late

Default charge for replacement of lost key or security device - Equivalent to cost incurred

Changing the tenancy documents after the commencement of the tenancy - £41.67 excl. VAT | £50 inc. VAT

Utilities, communication services, TV licence and council tax
            
A Non-Housing Act Tenancy is formed when one of the following criteria is in place:

  The annual rent exceeds £100,000
  The property is not used as a main or primary home      
  The property is occupied by an entity (Company let) rather that an individual
  There is a Resident Landlord

Please speak with our branch staff if you need clarity on which tenancy might apply in your circumstances.

Under the terms of the Tenant Fee Act if you enter into a NON-HOUSING ACT TENANCY, payments which may apply will be as follows (exclusive / inclusive of VAT):
            
Tenancy Setup Fee drafting and execution of tenancy agreement if supplied by us, collecting and holding the Tenancy Deposit as Stakeholder (where applicable), issuing relevant deposit protection certificates (where applicable) - £300 / £360

Check-in Fee checking into the property and reviewing inventory - Minimum of £115.00 / Minimum of £138.00

Comprehensive Reference Fee (per person, per company and per guarantor (if required) - £50 / £60

Renewal Administration negotiating and drafting extension to the fixed term - £150 / £180

Change of Sharer   During a fixed term - £625 / £750

Change of Sharer   At Renewal of fixed term - £250 / £300

Early Termination   Deed of Surrender - £125 / £150

Late payment of rent - Interest will be charged at 3% above the Bank of England base rate

Please note: The holding deposit can be paid on the Goodlord platform by debit card only. All other monies due must be paid via the Goodlord platform or into JOHNS&CO  client account by direct bank transfer. We are unable to accept cash. We do not accept credit cards.

properties.summary: Regent are proud to present this one-bedroom apartment in Agar House, part of the Goodluck Hope development. A new riverside neighborhood is located directly on the River Thames at the historic Leamouth Peninsula. Surrounded by water on three sides and situated adjacent to ...
properties.displayAddress: Agar House, Orchard Place, E14

customer.branchDisplayName: Regent Letting and Property Management, London

properties.feesApplyText:
For ASTs and Licenses starting before 1st June 2019, and all other tenancies: 
Tenancy Set-up (per tenancy): £480.00 
Guarantor reference fee: £31.20 where supporting a failed reference after initial application
Company reference fee: £30.00 
Check out fees: Studio £90 to 4 Bed £120 
Renewal fee: £120.00 per person reduced to £90.00 if paid within 2 weeks of invoice being sent.
Change of Sharer: £480.00 
Rent Arrears Chaser: £30.00 per letter/email sent to chase overdue rent.

For ASTs and Licenses starting on or after 1st June 2019:
Holding deposit (per tenancy): one weeks' rent
Security deposit (per tenancy): 5 weeks' rent (where the annual rent is below £50,000) or 6 weeks' rent (where the annual rent is £50,000 or above)
Unpaid rent: 3% above the Bank of England base rate from date due until date paid
Lost keys/security devices: Tenants are liable for paying the full cost incurred for replacement keys/security devices or locks. If extra costs are incurred there will be a charge of £15 per hour for the time taken in replacing keys/locks/other security devices. 
Variation of Contract: £50
Change of Sharer: £50 per replacement Tenant subject to Landlord's approval.
Early termination: all costs in re-letting the property as well as all rent due under the tenancy until the start date of the replacement tenancy. These costs will be no more than the maximum amount of rent outstanding on the tenancy.

Regent Letting and Property Management Limited are members of the UKALA Total Loss Client Money Protection Scheme, and are also members of The Property Ombudsman redress scheme. You can find out more details on our website   or by contacting us directly.
properties.formattedBranchName: by Regent Letting and Property Management, London
